Plot Summary: The story of a teenager who leaves his prep school and wanders around New York City, grappling with themes of alienation, identity, and the loss of innocence
Critique: A profound exploration of the human condition, the nature of growing up and the search for meaning in a chaotic world
Theme Analysis: A seminal work of American literature

Title & Author: "In Search of Lost Time" by Marcel Proust
Plot Summary: The story of a man's nostalgic recollections of his childhood, adolescence, and early adulthood, exploring themes of memory, time, and the nature of art
Critique: A profound exploration of the human condition, the nature of identity and perception, and the relationship between art and life
Theme Analysis: A seminal work of French literature

Plot Summary: The story of a man who commits a senseless murder and is indifferent to the consequences, exploring themes of alienation, absurdity, and the meaninglessness of life
Critique: A profound exploration of the human condition, the nature of existence and morality, and the search for meaning in a chaotic and indifferent world
Theme Analysis: A seminal work of French literature

Title & Author: "To Kill a Mockingbird" by Harper Lee
Main Characters: Scout Finch, Jem Finch, Atticus Finch
Plot Summary: The story of a young girl growing up in the American South and witnessing the injustices of racism and prejudice, exploring themes of morality, empathy, and the loss of innocence
Critique: A profound exploration of the human condition, the nature of courage and compassion, and the struggle for justice in a flawed world
Theme Analysis: A seminal work of American literature
